roleset.name: extract milk from a cow
roleset.note: MILK-V NOTES: Most of the time you'll not see the milk argument--it only appearswhen the verb is being more explicitly metaphorically, as in the firstexample below. Otherwise, the thing removed is mentioned within theverb itself. (from milk.01-v)

example.name: explicitly metaphorical
example.text: But Goya Foods Inc. believes it can milk some sales by bucking the trend.

example.name: extremely literal
example.text: The young leave, especially girls who *trace* won't milk cows by hand.

example.name: metaphorical, unmentioned milk
example.text: He forecasts that the emphasis in mergers and acquisitions may soon return to what he calls ``strategic deals, in which somebody-1 is taking over a company not *trace*-1 to milk the cash flow, but because it's a good fit.''

roleset.name: milk for variant: exploit
roleset.note: MILK-V NOTES: Note that"for all it's worth"cannot be regarded as a PRP (if it IS aPRP, then it should go in the other roleset). (from milk.02-v)

example.name: almost idiomatic
example.text: John milks his relationship with Mary for all it's worth.
